alert.note: Alert for Clark; Greene; Montgomery (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 10:54AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CLARK, GREENE AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 AM EDT... At 1054 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tipp City to near West Alexandria, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Springfield, Kettering, Beavercreek, Huber Heights, Fairborn, Xenia, Miamisburg, Springboro, Bellbrook, New Carlisle, Oakwood, Yellow Springs, Wright-Patterson Afb, Cedarville, Enon, Jamestown, South Charleston, Wilberforce and Riverside. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 39 and 70. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 58 and 61. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 42 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for central and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
